alert.note: Alert for Carroll; City of Galax (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 5:10PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following county and independent city, Carroll and City of Galax. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 510 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Hanks Branch, Chestnut Creek, Grassy Creek, Dixon Branch, Crooked Creek, Elk Spur Branch, Big Reed Island Creek, Johnson Creek, Garners Creek, East Fork Little Reed Island Creek, Island Creek and East Fork Crooked Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Galax... Hillsville... Fancy Gap... Cana... Pipers Gap... Lambsburg... Woodlawn... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
